peregrine
Class StructWriter

java.lang.Object
  peregrine.StructWriter

public class StructWriter
extends java.lang.Object

Write data to a struct and convert it to a StructReader when done. This is generally used for more complicated data structures consisting of multiple values / types strung together.

Also see StructReaders for a simbling class which provides easy factory methods for creating StructReaders instead of always having to use StructWriter.

writeBytes

public StructWriter writeBytes(byte[] bytes)
Write a length prefixed byte array to this struct. Call StructReader.readBytes() to read it back out. The length of the array will be preserved.

writeBytesFixed

public StructWriter writeBytesFixed(byte[] bytes)
Write a fixed length byte array to the struct. The length is NOT included so you will need to keep track of the lenght after the fact.

One can call StructReader.readBytesFixed(int) and specify the number of bytes you want to read.
